page.title: 09Ashbourne Industrial Estate.
page.content: At the southern edge of Ashbourne is a high plateau. This was used as an airfield during World War II but this is now largely overgrown and the land given over to{farming.}Barley is grown here and grass for hay and silage. There is also some rough grazing for a herd of sheep.At the eastern edge of the airfield adjoining the Derby Road is a small{industrial estate.}This contains a variety of manufacturing and commercial units,including a small brick and tile maker, an agricultural feed merchant, a supplier of tyres and exhausts and a firm re-cycling rubber. In a survey we found that only fourteen pupils had parents who worked on the industrial estate.This suggests that it is{not a major employer}of local labour, most of it's workforce coming from outside the area.
